availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Lester (Lyon County, Kentucky, merchant.)

body.p: Lyon County, Kentucky, merchant. Adair County, Kentucky, native. Son of Thomas Lester and Isabella Hay Lester. Married to Mary Jane Applegate on May 11, 1837. Father of George C. Lester, Mary Isabella Lester, John Lester, Thomas A. Lester, Willie C. Lester, James A. Lester, and Jesse Lester. Merchant in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Employed James M. Bigham as a clerk in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Caldwell County in 1850. Merchant in Lyon County in 1860. Employed William B. Bowman as a clerk in Lyon County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Lyon County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 327B.

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, Eddyville, p. 41B.
J.H. Battle, W.H. Perrin, G.C. Kniffin, Kentucky: A History of the State, vol 2 (Louisville, KY: F.A. Battey Publishing Company, 1885), 857.
